articles.title: About Me
articles.description: A brief glimpse into my background and interests.
articles.contents:
CLICK HERE FOR COMPLETE RESUME
Everest Region, NepalBio
Lucas Boyd graduated from the University of San Diego in 2016 with a B.A. in Behavioral Neuroscience. After completing his degree, he spent five years working in experiential and environmental education. His teaching adventures have taken him all over the world, leading students on a variety of environmental projects from rainwater collection in the Thai highlands to invasive lionfish eradication in Belize and many projects in between. After several years in education, Lucas now feels ready to broaden his lens and examine environmental issues and solutions from new perspectives. In particular, he is interested in data-driven decarbonization solutions, drawing on his neuroscience background and teaching experience to study how to best communicate scientific information and inspire meaningful action. In his free time, you can find Lucas on a mountain peak, a beach, or anywhere else that gets him outside. He is excited to continue to learn and grow as a professional and environmentalist here at Bren, where he is specializing in Energy and Climate with a focus on Strategic Environmental Communication.
Education
University of California Santa Barbara | Santa Barbara, CA
Masters of Environmental Science and Management | September 2021 - June 2023 Climate and Energy Specialization | Strategic Communication Focus
University of San Diego | San Diego, CA
B.S. in Behavioral Neuroscience | September 2012 - May 2016
Experience
UCSB Psychological and Brain Sciences | Teaching Assistant | September 2021 - Present
The Road Less Traveled | Training Director | June 2018 - June 2021
Exploring New Horizons | Environmental Educator | December 2017 - June 2020
Carpe Diem Education | Overseas Educator | August 2019 - December 2019

            Bio
            Frank Hermosillo studies neural networks and their applications at Google Brain. His research focuses on differentiable network pruning approximation and decentralized gradient inversion mechanics. He frequently collaborates with researchers who study machine learning, computer vision, and cognitive science. His work has been featured in WIRED, The Atlantic, Newsweek, and The New York Times Magazine.
            
            
            Education
            Massachusetts Institute of Technology | Cambridge, MA
            Ph.D. in Computer Science | September 2009 - May 2014
            The University of California, Berkeley | Berkeley, CA
            B.S. in Computer Science | September 2005 - May 2009
